artciles.q: 1. It is necessary to mention the temperature at which specific gravity is calculated, because of the following reasons:
option: Mass of the substance changes with temperature
Rigidity of the substance changes with temperature
Density of the substance changes with temperature
artciles.answer: Density of the substance changes with temperature
artciles.description: Since the volume of the substance changes with temperature, which means density of the substance changes with temperature, that’s why it is required to mention the temperature at which specific gravity is calculated.

artciles.q: What is the unit of specific gravity?
artciles.description: Specific gravity of a substance is the ratio of density of the substance and density of a reference substance, so it is dimensionless.

artciles.q: According to Stoke's law, the velocity at which grains settle out of suspension, all other factors being equal, is dependent upon

Mass of a substance is changing with respect to its volume as m = -v3 + 3v2 -2v, what is the maximum specific gravity of the substance between v = 1 m3 and v = 2 m3? (Density of reference substance = 0.25 kg/m3)
artciles.description: Density of substance D = m/v = -v2 + 3v – 2, => Specific gravity of substance S = D/0.25 = 4(-v2 + 3v – 2), => dS/dv = 4(-2v + 3) = 0, => v = 1.5, => S is maximum at v = 1.5, => maximum specific gravity = 4(-1.52 + 3*1.5 – 2) = 1.

artciles.q: The bulk density of coarse grained soils can be determined by
Dry density of soil can be defined as the ratio of
option: Weight of solids to total volume
Weight of soil to the total volume of solids
Unit weight of the soil to the unit weight of water
artciles.answer: Weight of solids to total volume

artciles.q: The water content of soil is defined as the ratio of
option: volume of water to volume of given soil
weight of water to weight of solids of given mass of soil.
artciles.answer: weight of water to weight of solids of given mass of soil.
